alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Monroe and southwestern Cumberland Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 623 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Burkesville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Monroe and southwestern Cumberland Counties, including the following locations... Littrell, Peytonsburg, Stalcup, Kettle, Meshack, Raydure, Tanbark, Judio, Ellington and Arat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
